website_summaries.verdict: With a unique, attractive look that also provides great protection, this durable case is lightweight enough for easy portability to performances.
pros: We love the tweed color and sleek design
It's thin with rounded corners, making it easy to carry while avoiding bumping into obstacles
At 10 pounds, it's the lightest of any case we considered
It fits all normal guitars snugly and latches securely, keeping the instrument safe during transport and carrying
cons: The thin design might limit the amount or size of accessories like straps that will fit in the case

customer_reviews.title: Better looking than it is functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool looking old school case that I wanted to love, but it has some drawbacks. The interior is great, and it fits my strat and tele bodies without complaint. Problem is, it can be stood on edge without falling over. This requires it be laid flat on the floor for storage. Huge foot print. Also kind of heavy for what it is. Overall, function lost to form.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: COULD NOT FIND KEY....at first
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good case from Fender. It looks nice and it serves its purpose. The main reason I'm writing this is in case somebody else has a problem of finding the key or figuring out how to open the case at first. The keys are inside of the case but in order to open it you have to slide the keyhole mechanism(located on each side) to the side to unlock each latch. I was not aware that these could move so I could not figure it out at first. Pretty solid case though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very poor overall craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: what did i like anything about the case , nothing!!!...what i didn't like is the cheezy hardware...the end material that wraps the case was sewn on loosely , looks like wrinkled bacon...what was especially bad was when i opened the case the toxic fumes that came drifting out,WOA ,the brain cells were deteriorating fast...slammed that shut in a hurry...needless to say its going back...FENDER PRO SERIES what a joke...I WOULD NEVER PUT MY NANE ON SUCH A PRODUCT... FENDER YOU HAVE HIT BOTTOM...guess you've joined corporate USA GREED CLUB
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good case, but I’m not entirely impressed by the quality compared to off-brand ones that cost less. The Musician’s Friend/Guitar Center brand cases that are often on sale for as low as $49 are just about the same build quality. One nice advantage over third party is that it is a perfect fit for on a Stratocaster. There is zero wiggle room on the inside for your guitar to be damaged, but there is almost no padding underneath the fuzzy fabric. I dont think that’s a problem, but a layer of padding would give you more peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for the Fender Stratocaster
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my Fender Stratocaster Deluxe. The interior is very plush and the guitar does not move around at all inside (very snug) I like the old school look. There are complaints about the quality but for this price, the protection it affords is priceless. The two compartments inside are large enough for the basics (hex keys, picks, guitar tuner, extra strings, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Rumplestilskin

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, but damaged by Fender
customer_reviews.text: Overall the case is (or would have been) fine except the hardware on one corner was ripped off and because the case is made of cheap fiberboard, was not repairable. The shipping box was not damaged, so the case was damaged by whomever packed it up at Fender. Because it was not [easily] repairable, I sent it back. I did not order a replacement as even without the hardware damage, the case appeared marginally sturdy. For storing in a closet I would say this is a fine case, but if you are a road warrior with your guitar, I would look into a better case.
customer_reviews.author: LarryCTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fender tele or strat guitar case
customer_reviews.text: the case was pretty good. but i had to tighten all the screws and one screw was stripped so i will have to get a screw a little larger and put it in later. the legs as stated in another review did have the tops of the screws sticking over the tops of the legs, but the seemed to get at least flush when i tightened them. over all it is well constructed for a low priced Fender case. after i use it for a while i may redo my review or add to it.
customer_reviews.author: B.D,W.

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty decent case
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent case, but it's actually too small to fit the Indonesian Squier Standard Strat I bought it for. The strap pegs on the Squier won't permit the body to slip down into the body well, and the large 60'- style headstock overlaps the rim on the headstock end of the case. Luckily, my U.S. strat fit into it okay, and the Squier Standard in turn fits into the old U.S. Fender case with its angled divider, so I was able to keep and use it after swapping cases.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid case
customer_reviews.text: Even though the case is at a higher price point than some others, it’s made specifically for p/j basses, and it has amazing quality. Has two briefcase style latches which lock, and one regular latch in the middle. The keys do come inside the case upon delivery, and to open the case, you slide the lock outwards.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Made in Taiwan garbage
customer_reviews.text: What a shame Fender moved production of these from Canada to Taiwan, the quality shows. One of the latches doesn’t close, the red material isn’t properly glued down in some places, and under the red felt there is creased cardboard like material that makes for sharp areas in the case that will brush against your guitar. There is also a stain on the case as well. I spent the extra money on a real fender product case and I was very disappointed that the quality was worse than cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J

customer_reviews.title: My American Strat fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I have Ernie Ball strap locks on my American Strat that adds a little length to front and back of the body. This case fit perfectly. Holds it solid. Craftsmanship is what you expect for the price range. Not overly extravagant and not overly cheap. I would purchase again. Matches my 3 Tone burst paint job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: C. W. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: This product is pretty tacky and you'll discover you're paying for the Fender name.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product without having seen it physically. Big mistake. It has a very cheap vinyl appearance in large part because it appears to be constructed from very cheap materials! In short, you're most likely paying for the Fender brand. Shortly after buying this case, I had it and an amp in the trunk of my car and, owing to having to brake hard, the amp toppled backwards and landed on the case. That was enough to result in several little visible tears in the vinyl on the case. The case is really pretty tacky and I regret having bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Nicol

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough case- does not fit a Fender Deluxe Active P Bass® Special
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this case along with a new bass; unfortunately the lid presses firmly against the volume and pickup knobs on a Fender Deluxe Active P Bass® Special so I have returned it to Amazon. Interior of the case is adequate, I would prefer it to have a little more "fluff" to the plush part but it's fine. It's some sort of formed plastic molding with a 1/4-1/2 inch of plush fibers. The case itself hugs a bass well enough and the outside of the case is very attractive. Perfectly fine case just be mindful that with certain models the top may apply some unwanted pressure to the bridge or knobs.
customer_reviews.author: darn1982

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why anybody would give this case a bad review. It is really nice for a $70 case. I have a Guitar Center FSR60S factory special run strat that didn't come with a case. This is perfect for it. Fits like a glove! The hardware is really nice, plush interior has no bad smell like one reviewer wrote. No cuts or damage to the tweed. I have to say I'm pleasantly surprised that this is as nice a case as it is. I just couldn't see spending over $200 for the other Fender case.
customer_reviews.author: QBL777

customer_reviews.title: Bait & Switch
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening, the first thing I noticed was the wrinkled sides as if it was about 20 years old. The second thing was the inside did not have a covered compartment as in the pictures. It’s open allowing whatever I need to put in there to fly around scratching and dinging my bass. Doesn’t really look like the pictures. I will be returning case. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Made in Vietnam. Tweed is not even glued down all the way. They used to be made correctly in Canada. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: the real scoop
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed when first seeing it after opening box. The edges of the case on both ends are wrinkled and not pulled tight, Makes it look cheap. However it was cheap, did not cost much. Everything else I was good with. I like the way it fit my USA strat, perfect with no moving around. It supports the neck nice with 12 inches of cutout from body to headstock. I liked the inside of case. I am putting a few photos. I may think about how to fix the vinyl, maybe add some leather strips or maybe just not sweat the small stuff in life and just play the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: pdp

customer_reviews.title: The shipping was fast and I would highly recommend both the case and the
customer_reviews.text: This case can handle the needs of your classic Fender or new one. It has the quality you expect from anything with the Fender name on it. The shipping was fast and I would highly recommend both the case and the company
customer_reviews.author: Col. Walt. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Case was falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The case looked great. But the inside layout was different from what was pictured, and a corner plate was falling off -- a screw popped out and was missing. I'd give it a 4 or 5 if it had the layout as pictured and the construction wasn't flawed.
customer_reviews.author: thipke

customer_reviews.title: Great light-duty case!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. It looks great inside and out, and seems pretty sturdy, but maybe I'm not using it for the right purpose. I don't gig much, but I travel with it a lot, and after a good number of hours in the car, it seems like the glue under the tweed loosened up a bit in the heat and now I've got bubbles. The case seems like it's good quality, but I would have hoped for more. Not sure it would be enough to keep me from buying again though.
customer_reviews.author: devinn_11

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case for the money I paid
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case for the money I paid. I gave four stars because the hardware and latches are attached with Phillips screws instead of rivets so anyone can unscrew the latches open the case and steal your guitar. Kinda renders the locks useless.
customer_reviews.author: Han Solo

customer_reviews.title: Fender Tweed Guitar Case
customer_reviews.text: Durable enough. Not quite up to G&G quality, but good enough to protect your guitar. They are Fender branded, so I presume they’ll hold-up well.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice case but watch the screws on the feet
customer_reviews.text: I put a nice scratch in the floor because the screws were put in with a power tool and had some burrs quick fix with a file and we were good to go
customer_reviews.author: Robert  Kidd

customer_reviews.title: nice case but......
customer_reviews.text: if you own a newer stratocaster they are great.. but if you own a older one it may be to large to fit.. Did fender cut that much wood off of the new ones to make this much difference?? mines a 1981 MIJ Strat and had to literally be stuffed into the case to fit
customer_reviews.author: Grimmee Rawker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I Have Bought 5 Of These Cases ! They work very well , Never had a Problem with any of them !! They Do The Job Exceptionally Well !!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rom

customer_reviews.title: Great Gig Case.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great case. Holds my Tele just fine and I like the accessory compartments. It's great for a gig but I would spend more for a heavy duty flight case if you were flying it much. Not a problem with the case, just the baggage handlers.
customer_reviews.author: Rob E

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good but Kinda Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good case. The "leather," stitching and tweed material on the outside is pretty thin and weak. It could use a little *toughness* on the exterior. The interior is fuzzy goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Craft

customer_reviews.title: Really fender
customer_reviews.text: It's a great case, but if you compare this to the standard P-Bass tweed case, you'd this one if a fake one. All the materials on this one is cheaper than the standard P-Bass tweed case. Even the handle is cheaply made plastic as opposed to the imitation leather on the p-bass case. The inside has no compartment doors where the P-bass one does have one WITH a divider (separate picks, strings or cables). Nonetheless, it's still a good case that will protect your investment.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a knock off Fender case from Vietnam. As far as sturdiness, I have not used it yet and not sure it will hold up if I do. Although it had Fender tags in the case and the Fender logo on the shipping box it did not have the Fender script or id on the case. My bad for not doing my homework. I needed a case regardless so I will make it work
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice Reto Look!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. I would not consider it good for shipping, but for local gigs and home protection it should be great. It looks very retro and it fits my Telecaster perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MS1954

customer_reviews.title: "Wouldn't Put a Stratocaster In Anything Else"
customer_reviews.text: The title of this review came from my dad. I had bought this for him as a gift. I really thought it was a bit pricey, until I saw the absolutely quality of this case. It's beautifully made. More importantly, the guitar is well protected. In the end, it's worth every dime.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth P.

customer_reviews.title: If It Ain’t Broke, Don’t Fix It.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything but the internal design. Fender took 1 large storage compartment and made 2 small ones on either side of the neck such that you cannot even fit a folded strap in it.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to figure out how in the world to open it the first time since the keys were inside but all you have to do is slide the little things to the side. Awesome case!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Always Wanted Classic Tweed
customer_reviews.text: I've had this 60s TELE with no case (part of a trade deal a few years ago) so I decided it needed a Tweed case!
customer_reviews.author: R L West

customer_reviews.title: lining odor
customer_reviews.text: The case itself is fine, but the lining.....has a very strong chemical odor. My husband has tried multiple times to leave this case open to air out and get that smell to go away, but it still is very potent.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy7th

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for Fender Standard Stratocaster
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the guitar I ordered about the same time from Amazon, Fender Standard Stratocaster HSS Plus Top, Maple Fingerboard - Aged Cherry Burst. Very well put together and no issues with craftsmanship. Plenty of room for cords and books, etc.
customer_reviews.author: GuyMc

customer_reviews.title: It says left or right handed bass NOT TRUE!!!
customer_reviews.text: It says left or right handed bass NOT TRUE!!! Totally false ad. This is only for a right handed bass!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing replication for the price. Fender strat fit perfectly! My daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.author: F. Gozum

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have read a few negative reviews regarding the quality of this case, and was not sure what to expect. I must say I was rather impressed with the overall quality and finish! They must of improved the quality, the inside was very plush and soft, and the rivets and seams appear to be well constructed. I have a nice American standard strat that fits perfectly in this case. I really like the vintage 70s look of this case and feel it should do the job. A great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Fender quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality case. Buy it if you have a real Fender Stratocatser.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classy, vintage looking, medium build ca$e
customer_reviews.text: I like it..as others have mentioned, it's probably a little over priced, but it fits my MIM Fender Strat super snug. It's not as tough as some other cases, but as someone who will only use it a couple times a month, I think itll fit my needs perfectly. I can confirm, however, that there is certainly a chemical order in the case; it's quite strong.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Miller

customer_reviews.title: You let me down, Fender!
customer_reviews.text: As time goes on, Fender disappoints me more and more with items such as cases. My top cover is warped, and the inside of the case is CHEAP! I'm keeping it just to store a bass, but stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Garvoon

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know that this would hold up to the rigors of the road, but for a weekend plucker like me, it’s perfect. Just enough style, and great protection. It’s custom-molded for a Fender bass, and fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Church Sound Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cortley that is almost and exact replica of a P-base. It fits this case like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Fender bass just fits had to use a bit of pressure to get in first couple of times but, all in all nice case
customer_reviews.author: Tomany 80's

customer_reviews.title: Budget case but not for regular usage....
customer_reviews.text: OK budget case...hardware is pretty basic, claps are kinda flimsy. Build construction is decent plywood style. Not a good case for consistent gigging or travel though. If you are looking to store guitars or causally take out...this case is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy great looks tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Tele. Fits great. Well built. I especially like the dual compartments. Lining looks great. Tele fits tight and is well protected. I definitely would recommend this case if you have a Tele or Strat that needs a good case.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: The good news is that the Return to Amazon was hassle ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to return this. The overall quality is cheap, and the felt interior started falling out within a couple days. The good news is that the Return to Amazon was hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: George D

customer_reviews.title: Case came with No Key
customer_reviews.text: no key if this case accidentally locks ill have to break it to get my guitar out.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Fender G&G!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. Much better quality than the G&G from Fender. I bought the G&G from Fender for $170 to compare side by side. Kept this one and retuned the G&G from Fender. The G&G from Fender is not the same quality as it was many years ago...
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Strat
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my girlfriend for her starburst Fender Strat and it looks great and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a Fender case that was defective but out of warranty
customer_reviews.author: R. Seton

customer_reviews.title: Good case for price-point.
customer_reviews.text: Great Strat case for the money. I would have preferred "Made in USA", even if it costs more. However, the quality seems adequate for now. We will see how this holds up in a mature and mellow environment, as I am no longer on tour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fender tweed, need I say more.
customer_reviews.text: Just a sharp looking guitar case with that classic fender tweed and red felt interior. How can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Class!
customer_reviews.text: This case is nothing but class. The vintage covering is pretty tough for being cloth. Solid hardware. Great workmanship...Of course, It's a Fender. Be prepared, the interior is a shocker. A red, plush, molded, insert that surrounds the contours of the instrument and fits your Jazz Bass like a warm glove. What a great way to carry, and show-off, your vintage J Bass or a new acquisition.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good price....nice case!
customer_reviews.text: My Squire/Fender Telecaster fits and looks great in it and for the price I'm very happy...Nuf Said!
customer_reviews.author: John V

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the money
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my Fender MIM Strat. Well constructed and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Proceptions

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality , you can defenatly tell product was not made in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: They need to get a better hold on their quality control , at any price .
customer_reviews.author: william kantor

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Case
customer_reviews.text: My Fender case arrived on time and in great shape. It fits Squire 5 string like a glove. No strong odor. Very clean, looks very well put together. Hinges and latches work well.
customer_reviews.author: V. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Old School Look - Very Good Protection
customer_reviews.text: After many year of service the original case for my strat was falling apart. Don't let the tweed look fool you - this is a rugged, well built case. My strat fits in nice and secure. The case has two storage compartments.
customer_reviews.author: TJB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case!
customer_reviews.text: This tweed case is just what we were looking for to hold my husband's guitar. The inside is soft, if a little retro. Another well constructed case by Fender.
customer_reviews.author: C & P's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great case, been using for a year now, never disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M.

customer_reviews.title: Had a little dent by UPS that I was able ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a little dent by UPS that I was able to push out. Does everything it's supposed to do. Can't fit a strap with locks into the two compartments without a little witchcraft.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Collins

customer_reviews.title: It's the black style fender hard case
customer_reviews.text: And it's a great place to store a strat or a tele.
customer_reviews.author: rigger7906

customer_reviews.title: Price was too,good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my,mexi strat. Fits perfect gives it a cool 70s. Vibe and protection. Got it for a steal at Christmas time.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great case! 5-String Fender Jazz
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for my Fender 5-string Jazz. The appearance, and construction of the case very durable
customer_reviews.author: Marion Idzi

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was stellar! Fits my MIM Tele well and it arrived in brand new condition. There is about an inch of wiggle from neck to butt, but to be expected from a cheaper case. Overall great value for light duty use. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: 1993 Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case
customer_reviews.text: Just what I hoped it would be: Old style "tweed" that fits my Tele well. There is a little play here and there, but regardless of which case I use, I will always place loose pieces of foam to hold the guitar steady.
customer_reviews.author: S Michael

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping for a better quality. The outside craftsmanshipship isn't what it use ...
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for a better quality. The outside craftsmanshipship isn't what it use to be. The inside material is pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good case, It's not like the G&G case (which ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good case, It's not like the G&G case (which cost twice as much), but it will be fine. The Tele fits fine in it& it should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice case, fits the jazz bass perfectly. Edit: March 2020: used this to check the bass in for a flight from Cali to NC--no problems for the bass or the case.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Good quality nothing fits a Fender guitar like a Fender case!
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN C MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Quality case.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in every way. Excellent workmanship. Quality inside and out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: No Sevens

customer_reviews.title: Good quality case, real tweed cloth covering, good price
customer_reviews.text: Worth spending the extra few dollars for real tweed and better quality. I have since lacquered the tweed to give it the look of a '50's case. "relicing" they call it these days.
customer_reviews.author: keith applebaum

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my new Telecaster American Special. Love the tweed look.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Bad latch
customer_reviews.text: Has never left the house...One of the latches does not close properly...I have owned a few of these over the years...This one is a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: JL.Florida

customer_reviews.title: Nice case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for the price. Wish the accessory compartment had a lid. Other than that,My Fender P bass fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: subversive1

customer_reviews.title: Guitar case fits for my Yamaha Pacifica and other strat style guitars!
customer_reviews.text: This case arrived on time and in good conditions As a matter if fact arrived earlier jajaja I bought it for a Yamaha Pacifica and fits 100% The interior is pretecting the guitar in a smooth way Outside looks classy! I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Fender vintage case
customer_reviews.text: I received it damaged, but I like the case, perfect for my Mexican Strat,
customer_reviews.author: oilman

customer_reviews.title: Good case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great case for the price, I like it better than the more expensive retro case because this ones interior is formed to fit your p or l bass like a glove, where the other is not, I feel that my bass is safe in this case, and it is well made and has a cool look, can hold my strap, cord and tuner also!
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for a tele
customer_reviews.text: Little to snug I know it will wear down and fit better. “Strat”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: New case for my telecaster. Guitar came with an ill fitting gig bag. American made tele deserved a better place to lay. This case fit like a glove. And the price was right. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it. A little heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and the look is very cool and vintage.
customer_reviews.author: Peregrine Family

customer_reviews.title: Best Case ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this case, strong, sturdy and the tweed is awesome. Will be buying more. Plenty of room for a start or tele, plus cords and pedals. If in doubt, get it. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Built really well--"hugs" your bass, no slip/sliding around---more expensive but worth it..Squire 5 string fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Donna E Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loved it for his tele...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson for Christmas. He loved it and the tweed finish is just different enough to be sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: Good for the buck
customer_reviews.text: It's very beautiful and protects your gear, but is definitely weaker than traditional hard cases. I will never dispatch my guitar as luggage relying only on this, but it's great for what you pay
customer_reviews.author: Sergio D Pereira

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy case
customer_reviews.text: The binding could be attached better, and the latches are stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Pagliaro

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: The case is a great value for the money. This is a very nice case for tele or start
customer_reviews.author: VegasGuitar58

customer_reviews.title: Decent case. Holds a Strat snugly. Hardware is ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent case. Holds a Strat snugly. Hardware is attached using screws, as opposed to rivets found on higher quality cases. Fairly certain the higher price paid was due to the Fender logo.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest T. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Got this today, poorly made. The latch is ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this today, poorly made. The latch is so sharp that you can cut yourself if not careful. Cheap looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Hai Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: IT does what you buy it for well. But ...
customer_reviews.text: IT does what you buy it for well. But you can feel that it is Plastic and it feels cheap. Vynle ends instead of Leather Plastic Handle. But at least you dont have to worry about it getting messed up gigging.
customer_reviews.author: T. N. Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: Case for my Fender JA 90 Telecaster
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today for my new Fender JA 90 Telecaster. A perfect fit as advertised. Nice vintage looking case, no obvious issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: sailor

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Was supposed to arrive Monday
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Love it. Was supposed to arrive Monday...got here Saturday! Super quick. Couldn’T be happier.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to find that the storage area inside the case had NO LID on it like the Fender cases that I owned in the 1980's...
customer_reviews.author: P. Brichta

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove..perfect for jazz bass
customer_reviews.text: It fit my fender getti lee. Signature jazz bass perfectly..great case..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good price on what was expected
customer_reviews.text: The product is as expected. These cases are overpriced, but the price from this vendor was decent. Much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: MusicGearUser

customer_reviews.title: New Case for my New Bass
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this case was going to fit my new Fender Modern Player Telecaster Bass & though it isn't exact it is a good fit. One of the locks is a bit jammed but I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great Fender Quality Case
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected from the world’s biggest instrument manufacturer. Perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great classy case
customer_reviews.text: Great classy case. Nice fuzzy interior. More for a casual storage and not airline worthy, but I love the look.
customer_reviews.author: Jun Kumazawa
